events.title: Naval Force D Sets Strategic Sweep Through Aegean Ahead of May 21st Operation
events.description: (a) Force D consisting of R.A.D. in DIDO -with ORION, AJAX, ISIS, KIMBERLEY,  IMPERIAL and JANUS, was to pass the Anti Kithera Channel by 2200/20th May, sweep Capes Malea Hydra Phalconera and be off Canea at 0700/2ist.

events.title: Turning Point in the Skies: Navy Strikes Major Blow Against German Forces in Battle of Crete
events.description: 4. The air attack on Crete started on the 20th May, 1941. The sweeps of the Light Forces on the night 2oth/2zst and during daylight 21st were uneventful except for heavy air attacks and the unlucky loss of H.M.S. JUNO (see paragraphs 14 to 20).  As far as the Navy was concerned, the real Battle of Crete began on the night of 21st/22nd May, with the successful encounter of Force D with an enemy convoy (see paragraph 23). This encounter was. skilfully and thoroughly exploited, was a heavy blow to the Germans and an encouragement for our hard pressed troops in Crete.

events.title: 15,000 Tons of Army Supplies Unloaded Amidst Fierce Air Attacks: Eight Ships Damaged or Sunk
events.description: 3. During the period Bre 2gth April to 20th May, some 15,000 tons of Army stores were offloaded from 15 ships, whilst eight ships were sunk or damaged in the harbour by air attack.

events.title: Strategic Reserves in Alexandria: Preparing for Potential Sea-Lane Challenges Ahead of Crete's Airborne Assault
events.description: Alexandria, which is 420 miles from Suda, A force was to be held in reserve at Alexandria as an attack might-start at a time when our forces at sea were getting short of fuel. Although the first airborne attack on Crete did not take lace until the 20th May, naval forces had to be kept teaay  at sea from the 14th May onwards

events.title: Commander-in-Chief Addresses Eighth Army: Strategic Insights from Cairo, May 1942
events.description: Letter from the Commander-in-Chief, M.E.F., to the Commander, Eighth Army. Cairo, 20th May, 1942.

events.title: Troops Deployed to Bodo: Guards Brigade and Irish Companies Set Sail Amidst Strategic Operations
events.description: On the same day I despatched the Headquarters of the 24th Guards Brigade (for the third time) and half the South Wales Borderers in destroyers to Bodo which they reached safely on 20th May. They were followed on 2ist May by two Companies of the Irish Guards in   puffers , the journey by   puffer   taking about 24 hours against nine by destroyers,

events.title: Strategic Meetings Set Stage for Massive Channel Evacuation: Vice Admiral Takes Command
events.description: 3. Further meetings were held at Dover on the 20th May, and at the War Office on the 21st May, to consider the   emergency evacuation across the Channel of very large Forces.  These meetings determined the number of personnel vessels and small craft available, and confirmed that the control of all sea movements rested with the Vice Admiral, Dover, a liaison officer from the War Office Movement Control and from the Ministry of Shipping being attached to the Vice Admiral.

events.title: Dawn Assault: Heavy Bombing Strikes Maleme Aerodrome on May 20th
events.description: 60. The main enemy attack began soon. after  dawn on 20th May, with a heavy bombing attack on Maleme aerodrome. Under cover of

events.title: Air Force Bolsters Ground Troops with New Close Support Group Amid Strategic Advances
events.description: 27. The Air Force had nullified the enemy air opposition after attacks on Dessie aerodrome on 6th April and on Gimma aerodrome on 1oth April, and as the aircraft were therefore available I arranged with Air Headquarters for the formation of a close support group in order to give the divisional Commanders additional air support for their operations. During the advance of the 1st S.A. Brigade towards Dessie 4 Hartbees and 4 Gladiator aircraft had been put under the operational command of the Brigade Commander and the value of their close support had been proved. Accordingly a Close Support Group consisting of two flights of Battle bombers, one flight of Gladiator fighters and two flights of Hartbees co-operation aircraft, was formed on 20th May and put under command of 11th (A) Division.

events.title: Record-Breaking Naval Convoy Battles Adversity Amidst Enemy Threats
events.description: 26. P.Q.16, which sailed on 20th May, contained 35 ships and, despite the fact that this was the most unfavourable time of the year, was the largest convoy which had so far been me It was escorted by five destroyers, four ites, four trawlers, one minesweeper and A.A. ship. events.title: Mark Your Calendars: Exciting Events Unfolding on May 20th!
Canadian Troops Advance West of Garigliano Near Capua
events.description: North of Capua concentrated west of R, Garigliano 20th May passed through 3 Cdn. Inf. Bde. 24th May.
